intro: Phyllostegia chamissonis, commonly known as the narrowleaf bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pink to reddish-purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators. Phyllostegia chamissonis is often found in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes.
